text: Moran and Mack in character in 1929. George Moran (October 3, 1881 – August 1, 1949) was an American minstrel show performer who worked in blackface. He worked with Charles Mack as the Two Black Crows from 1921 to 1930. He also portrayed Native Americans in comedy films.George Moran at IMDb ==Biography== He was born on October 3, 1881 in Elwood, Kansas as George Searcy. He died on August 1, 1949 in Oakland, California. ==Selected filmography== * The Fatal Glass of Beer (1933) as Indian Chief * My Little Chickadee (1940) as Milton, a Native American * Alias the Deacon (1940) as Taciturn Indian ==References== ==External links== * Category:1881 births Category:1949 deaths Category:Blackface minstrel performers Category:Vaudeville performers Category:20th-century singers
title: George Moran (comedian)
